L2_gloss:
here, this place
Kasà à abanay kà mazàh anu ala, tsa kaslà adàslay dadàŋ aw takay? (Mata 8:29)[1]Have you come here to torment us before the time? (Matthew 8:29)
Delga à uwana məga la abanay zla (Mata 17:4)[2][It is] good that we are here. (Matthew 17:4)

here, this place
Ŋgaha tadzàh madzay la abatà kà manəŋla. (Mata 27:36)[1]And they sat down and were watching over him there. (Matthew 27:36)
Tadà aŋatà la abatà, taguwà à uda la kutso Galili la abà (mark 9:30)[2]And from there they went out and passed through Galilee (Mark 9:30)
face
sun, Ŋgaha uwana afats adàdzəka mavəɗay la ndzəɗa,

wind
Iyaw adzəkà masuway, ahənà à mukwà à afik, afaɗ aɗə̀ɗ la ndzəɗa, ŋgaha gày atə̀ɗ à ahəŋ gərim, matəɗ à ahəŋ aŋha kà panàhhà." (Mata 7:27)[1]And the rain came down and the river came and the wind blew and beat against that house, and it collapsed, and its fall was great.” (Matthew 7:27)
Tadà à kəslah iyaw à afik atà səla, ŋgaha afaɗ aɗə̀ɗ aya aw, adzà à ahəŋ titi. (Mata 14:32)[2]And when they got into the boat, the wind didn't blow any more. (Matthew 14:32)

tree
Kəla ahàf uwana av mayyay delga aw, agay manats à ahəŋ gà ŋgaha maduw à akàl à tsəh. (Mata 3:10)[1]therefore every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire. (Matthew 3:10)

hand
Baŋa kà ahàl aŋak la uwana katəɗ à tsakana à abà, nàts à tsəh ala, ŋuləm kà kaɓəz à sifa la ahàl tekula, kà magay la ahàl səla nna, uwana adàdala kà à gày akàl uwana à abà adàməts ala aw (Mark 9:43)[1]And if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off! It is better for you to enter into life crippled than, having two hands, to go into hell—into the unquenchable fire! (Mark 9:43)

stone
Kiya uwaga seteni azà vok à slaka aŋha la magoɗal: "Baŋa kak Kona aŋa Zəzagəla ndzer kà, 'Pàk kaf!', gòɗ à akur uwanay." (Mata 4:3)[1]And the tempter approached and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, order that this stone become bread.” (Matthew 4:3)
fire, Akàl asa à ahəŋ la zagəla, abaɓəh atà à gay.[2]Fire

tongue
Adəɓanì alàh aŋha (Mark 7:33)[2]He touched his tongue (Mark 7:33)

but
Dza uwana asal matəf gəl aŋha, adàziŋ ala, ama dza uwana az gəl aŋha ala kà gi, adàɓəl gəl aŋha. (Mata 16:25)[1]For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life on account of me will find it. (Matthew 16:25)

other
Azladza anik tasàhàh ŋgərpa aŋuvaw (Ibəranəŋkowen 11:35)[1]But others were tortured (Hebrews 11:35).

we, us (first-person plural pronoun)
Sufəl gulo, delga kà anu la abanay (Mark 9:5).[1]My Lord, [it is] good that we [are] here(Mark 9:5)
Musa atsetsèr à anu mapəhay uwanay (Luka 20:28).[2]Moses wrote to us saying this (Luke 20:28)
foot, The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand

bone
Tatak uwana anaka taɗehəŋ la azlaaslasl aŋha, à mok uwana adamətsay kà apə̀h à atà gay aŋha. (Ibəranəŋkowen 11:22)[1]He gave instructions concerning the burial of his bones. (Hebrews 11:22)

they, them (third-person plural pronoun)
Yesu awùlla à atà ala. (Mata 12:3)[1]Jesus answered to them. (Matthew 12:3)
Gi kà, gi la gudəŋ la vok aya aw, ama atà kà, atà la gudəŋ la vok.  (Yuhana 17:11)[2]And I am no longer in the world, and they are in the world. (John 17:11)

Used to form plurals.
‎azla- + ‎baba (“father”) → ‎azlababa (“fathers”)
‎azla- + ‎slodzi (“soldier”) → ‎azlaslodzi (“soldiers”)

(interrogative) where
Tanavàl: "Aŋala dza uwatà la?"(Mark 11:28)[1]And they said to him, “Where is that man?” He said, “I do not know.” (Mark 11:28)
Aŋala madiŋal gəl à vok aŋkul la? (Luke 8:25)[2]Where is your faith? (Luke 8:25)
his, her, its (third-person possessive pronoun), Dza

hair
Amiyaka aŋidz takasagəl aŋkul gesina kà, Zəzagəla asəl, la tekula tekula gesina aŋha. (Luka 12:7)[2]Even the hairs of your head, God know everyone of them(Luke 12:7)

blood
Kà uwana aŋiz aŋa azlabahu la azlavəlik la azlakokur aslàla vok kà mazəɓ atà tsakana aŋatà lakəl ala aw. (Ibəranəŋkowen 10:4)[1]For it is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins. (Hebrews 10:4)

many
Gi la azlagay aŋuvaw kà mapəh à akul.(Yuhana 16:12)[1]I still have many things to say to you (John 16:12).
Sufəl, azladza aŋuvaw tapə̀h à gi lakəl aŋa dza uwaga (Sləray 9:13)[2]Lord,  many people spoke to me of this man (Acts 9:13).

many
Aŋuvaw tadàgoɗ à gi 'Sufəl, Sufəl..." (Mata 7:22)[3]Many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord..." (Mata 7:22).

father
La katskats tasàk à kəslah iyaw aŋatà à ahəŋ la baba aŋatà gà, tanəfà Yesu. (Mata 4:22)And immediately they left the boat and their father and followed Jesus. (Matthew 4:22)
leaf
baptism, Asà à slaka Yuhana kà maɗahalla batem[1]He

if
Ama baŋa dza anik atsa à waŋ la maslay aŋa aslasl gəl aŋha kà, kakəsaw (Yuhana 5:43)[1]But if another should come in his own name, you would accept that one! (John 5:43)

to burn
Haɗay gà kà, Zəzagəla uwana mədəval kuɗa kà masla kà bokuba akàl, uwana abaɓəh tatak uwana à gay, akəsà gəl aŋha aw. (Ibəranəŋkowen 12:29)[1]For indeed our God is a burning fire. (Hebrews 12:29)

snake
Awma avàl ma bebi à baŋa anaval kà kilfi ay? (Mata 7:10)[1]Or also if he will ask for a fish, will give him a snake? (Matthew 7:10)

green
Yesu agòɗ à azlaməna matapla la slaka aŋha, kà azladza tadzàhà madzay la dzibokw dzibokw la kəsaf biyaga la afik. (Mark 6:39)[1]And he ordered them all to recline in groups on the green grass (Mark 6:39)

dust
Taɗèɗ à atà burburu aŋa gudəŋ aŋatà à adi, ŋgaha tahàd aŋatà à Ikoniyum. (Sləray 13:52)[1]So after shaking off the dust from their feet against them, they went to Iconium. (Acts 13:52)

child
Ama bəzi aŋatà la ahəŋ aw (Luka 1:7).[2]And they did not have a child (Luke 1:7)

small
Kasəlaw kà, kà bəzi akàl kà, abaɓəh mələm məŋga à gay gesina, ɓəhbaɓəh. (Yakuba 3:5)[3]Behold how small a fire sets ablaze how great a forest! (James 3:5)

to throw, cast
Mok uwana Yesu auguzahay la gay mukwà aŋa Galili kà, anəŋà Səmon uwana tazallala Piyer atà la deda aŋha Andəre, uwana tadàw dzarawa aŋatà à iyaw à abà; kà uwana atà azlaməna makas kilfi. (Mata 4:18)[1]Now as he was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew, who were casting net into the sea (for they were fishermen). (Matthew 4:18)

brother
Apakà vok kalkal la uwaga la deda masəla bay (Mata 22:26).[1]Now there were seven brothers with us. (Matthew 22:26)

good, well
Delga à uwana məga la abanay zla (Mata 17:4)[2][It is] good that we are here. (Matthew 17:4)

good
Anu azladza delga (Mata 23:28)[3]We [are] good people. (Matthew 23:28)

daughter
Dugu aŋa Herodiya ahàb dəs la huma aŋa azladza uwana tazàlàh atà. (Mata 14:6)[1]The daughter of Herodias danced in the midst of them (Matthew 14:6)
person, human being, Azladza uwana tapə̀h kiya uwanay
to sit, La mavakay uwatà Yesu asà à uda la kay, ŋgaha
to sit, La mavakay uwatà Yesu asà à uda la kay, ŋgaha

to sleep
Dugu uwanay kà, adamətsay aw, ama adzehal pəra! (Mark 5:39)[1]The girl is not dead, but is sleeping. (Luke 5:39)

to think
Baŋa dza adzugw kà masla aŋa magay masla maz sayda aŋa Zəzagəla, baŋaw adzugw kà, kà adaɓəza ndzəɗa aŋa Masasəɗok Zəzagəla, delga, masla asəlay kà uwanay gətsetser à akul, kà mapəhay aŋa Sufəl Zəzagəla. (1 Korintiya 14:37)[1]If anyone thinks he is a prophet or spiritual, he should recognize that the things which I am writing to you are of the Lord. (1 Corinthians 14:37)

horn
Kà aŋa azladərew kulo aŋa tatagà uwaga kà, kanəŋàŋ kà, masla apəhla ala kà lakəl aŋa azlasufəl kulo. (Mafətala 17:12)[1]And the ten horns that you saw are ten kings.(Revelation 17:12)

sea
La mavakay uwatà Yesu asà à uda la kay, ŋgaha ahàd adzà madzay la gay dərəv kà matapla tatak à azladza. (Matthew 13:1)[1]​On that day Jesus came out of the house and was sitting by the sea. (Matthew 13:1)

plant
Kela fofulo uwana Baba gulo uwana la zagəla la afik asləkà aw kà, adàgay maɓəɗ à ahəŋ gà.(Mata 15:13)[1]Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted. (Matthew 15:13)

mouth
Apokwà gay aŋha aw (Sləray 8:32)[2]He did not open his mouth. (Acts 8:32)

all
Kay, kakəɗ vok aŋak aw, anu gesina gami la ahəŋ (Sləray 16:28)[1]Do not harm yourself! We are all here! (Acts 16:28).
Gesina aŋatà kà taslay kulo gəl aŋha səla.  (Sləray 19:7)[2]All of them were about twelve men (Acts 19:7).

I, me (first-person singular pronoun)
Gi zil Yahudiya, tayyà gi à Tarsus uwana la Səlisəya, gi bəzi huɗ gudəŋ məŋga gà (Sləray 21:39).[1]I [am] a Jewish man, I was born in Tarsus which [is] in Cilicia, I [am] a man from an important city (Acts 21:39)
Dagay lakana kadànəŋaw gi aya tsəràh à uwana (Mata 23:39).[2]For I tell you, you will never see me from now on until you say (Mathhew  23:39)

wing
Atà tavà gogozlàh à mis  (Mafətala 12:14)[1]They gave wings to the woman (Revelation 12:14)

to swim
Avà tetəvi à azlauwana tasə̀l magosagosa kà mavalàh à iyaw à abà kà mats à vok à kutso à abà. (Sləray 27:43)[1]He gave orders that those who were able to swim should jump in first to get to the land. (Acts 27:43)

to say
Ama mana wakità agoɗ ma? (Galatiya 4:30)[1]But what does the scripture say? (Galatians 4:30)

tail
Gudaz aŋatà godam la gay, bokuba aŋa azlaaliz, gudaz aŋatà uwaga la uwana avà à atà ndzəɗa kà mamalla azladza tsəràh à təla zlo. (Mafətala 9:3)[1]And they have tails similar in appearance to scorpions, and stings, and their power to injure people for five months is in their tails. (Revelation 9:3)

world
Azlaanik kalkal la gày atàk uwana azlafofulo tanis à abà: Tatsəna gay Zəzagəla, ama madzugway la adi aŋa gudəŋ à vok uwanay, la matsiɗay aŋha, la mapapatay aŋha lakəl aŋa ləmana asufa gay uwana ala la ləv aŋatà la tsəh, ŋgaha ahən aw. (Mata 13:22)[2]And what was sown into the thorn plants—this is the one who hears the word, and the anxiety of this world and the deceitfulness of wealth choke the word and it becomes unproductive. (Matthew 13:22)

head
Sufəl, tsa kità kà, kapal gi azlaasik pəra aw, ama pal gi azlaahàl gulo, la gəl gulo gesina (Yuhana 13:9)[2]Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head . (John 13:9)
Nàts gi gəl aŋa Yuhana à tasà à abà, kavà à gi (Mata 14:8)[3]Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter (Matthew 14:8)

to sing
Atà tahàb mahabay mawga (Mafətala 5:9)[1]And they were singing a new song. (Revelation 5:9)

cloud
Gənəŋà habaga meɗekuga (Mafətala 5:6)[1]I saw a white cloud(Revelation 5:6)

to walk, go
Kamkam, kahad à Urusalima aw! (Sləray 21:21)[1]Don't go to Jerusalem! (Acts 21:12)

to fly
La kità aya, gənəŋà zulo uwana ahoyay la ləv zagəla  (Mafətala 8:1)[1]And I looked, and I heard one eagle that flies directly overhead (Revelation 8:1)
"Sà à waŋ, sà à waŋ", tagòɗ à mamətsay, ama mamətsay ahòy atà à ahàl. (Mafətala 9:6)[2]Come here, come here, they said to the death, but the death flew from them. (Revelation 9:6)

stomach, belly
Kasəlaw kà kəla tatak uwana ad à huɗ aŋa dza kà aguw à uda la godega aw takay?  (Mata 15:17)[2]Do you not understand that everything that enters into the mouth goes into the stomach and is evacuated into the latrine? (Matthew 15:17)
rain, Iyaw adzəkà masuway, ahənà à mukwà à afik, afaɗ

mother
Uwa à iyà gulo la azladeda gulo uwa? (Mata 12:48)Who is my mother, and who are my brothers? (Matthew 12:48)

(interrogative) how
Kakay makoray aŋha ad à huma à gay aya ma?  (Mark 11:28)[1]How will his kingdom stand? (Mark 11:28)
Tsa baŋa David la gəl aŋha kà azàlalla Sufəl ma, kakay apàk kona aŋha ma?" (Luka 20:44)[2]David therefore calls him ‘Lord,’ and how is he his son?”(Luke 20:44)
fish, Bokuba uwana Yonas aɗahà mavakay makər la mahənay

son
Masla uwanay, la uwana Kona gulo uwana gi gəkə̀sànì.(Luka 9:35)[1]This one, He is my Son that I have chosen (Luke 9:35)
Kona aŋa Zəzagəla ― Son of God

to have, gain
Mana akəs vok à dza, uwana akor gudəŋ à vok gesina, ŋgaha masla adàz gəl aŋha ala la makəɗ gəl à vok aŋha ma? (Mata 16:26)[1]For what is a person benefited if he gains the whole world but loses or forfeits himself? (Matthew 16:26)

ten
Kà aŋa azladərew kulo aŋa tatagà uwaga kà, kanəŋàŋ kà, masla apəhla ala kà lakəl aŋa azlasufəl kulo. (Mafətala 17:12)[1]And the ten horns that you saw are ten kings.(Revelation 17:12)
dog, Delga kà mazəɓ kaf aŋa azlabəza kà maməl à azlakəda
to cut

far
Ama ləv aŋatà kà kərkər la gi (Mata 15:8)[2]But their heart is far away from me. (Matthew 15:8)

smoke
Atà tanərə̀z mok uwana tanəŋà kəsək akàl, uwana abaɓə̀h gudəŋ, tawiyà la ndzəɗa: "Tekeɗik kà gudəŋ anik la ahəŋ, kà aŋa magagazla la masla aw!". (Mafətala 18:18)[1]They began to cry out when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, “Who is like the great city?” (Revelation 18:18)

to kill
Takə̀s, tadùw à uda la guf la abà, takə̀ɗ. (Mata 21:39)[1]And they seized him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. (Matthew 21:39)

to laugh
Marabay agay la akul uwana katuwaw lagwa, kà uwana kadàkəɗaslaw (Luka 6:21)[1]Blessed are those who weep now, because you will laugh.(Luke 6:21)

to fall down, to throw oneself down
Gədàvà à ka uwaga gesina, à baŋa ka kəɗeɗ à gi à ahəŋ kasləkaw gi. (Mata 4:9)[1]“I will give to you all these things, if you will fall down and worship me.” (Matthew 4:9)

in
Kak la marabay, Səmon kona aŋa Yuhana, kà uwana dza asik à uwana apə̀hakala dziriga uwaga aw, ama Baba gulo uwana la zagəla la afik la uwana apə̀hakala uwaga.(Mata 16:17)[1]Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.(Matthew 16:17)

heart
Ama ləv aŋatà kà kərkər la gi (Mata 15:8)[1]But their heart is far away from me. (Matthew 15:8)

worm
La abatà maduwari uwana azuw vok amətsay aw, ŋgaha akàl bay amats ala aw. (Mark 9:48)[1]Where their worm does not die and the fire is not extinguished. (Mark 9:48)

three
Kà uwana la slaka uwana azladza səla baŋaw makər taham gay à vok la sləm gulo kà, gi la tataka aŋatà la abà. (Mata 18:20)[1]For where two or three are gathered in my name, I am there in the midst of them. (Matthew 18:20)
death, "Sà à waŋ, sà à waŋ", tagòɗ à mamətsay, ama

black
Gənərə̀z, ŋgaha gənəŋà pəlis marsiga (Mafətala 6:5)[1]And I looked, and I saw a black horse (Mafətala 6:5)
second, Uwaga la uwana agay mamətsay masəla. (Mafətala

red, scarlet, purple
Yesu asà à uda la gabaga aŋa atàk lakəl, la deri mativga la vok vikuza (Yuhana 19:5)[1]Jesus came outside wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. (John 19:5)
Masla la uwana asə̀lla azladza à uda la Misəra la maɗahàh azlamasəlay la azlanadzipo anik anik la abatà, ŋgaha la gay dərəv mativga, ŋgaha la fəta la abà, tsəràh à mavay dzik ufaɗ. (Sləray 7:36)[2]This man led them out, performing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and at the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.(Acts 7:36)

day
Bokuba uwana Yonas aɗahà mavakay makər la mahənay makər la huɗ aŋa kilfi babay kà, (Mata 12:40)[1]For just as Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish three days and three nights (Matthew 12:40)
Mavakay mukwa la ahəŋ la tsəh aŋa kasukwa, à uwana dza aslala vok aŋa maɗàh sləray.(Luka 13:14)[2]There are six days on which it is necessary to work.(Luke 13:14)

year
Kəla mavay azlababa aŋha tadàhah à Urusalima kà aŋa madəvaday Paska. (Luka 2:41)[1]Every year his parents went to Jerusalem for the feast of the Passover. (Luke 2:41)

old, previous, former
Azlatatak maviyaga kà adada à lig (Mafətala 21:4)[1]The former things have passed away (Revelation 21:4)

new

flower
Kəsaf agulla ala, mawuratatay aŋha asakway. (1 Piyer 1:24)[1]The grass withers and the flower falls off. (1 Peter 1:24)

(interrogative) when
Mbà mənəŋà ka kak məlok gà, ŋgaha məkə̀s kà la ahàl səla, baŋaw mənəŋà ka la godega deyday ŋgaha məduwà à ka lukut à vok ma? (Mark 25:43)[1]When did we see you a stranger and welcome you as a guest, or naked and clothe you?(Mark 25:43)
white, Azladza səla tatsìzlla atà à vok la lukut meɗekuga

six
Mahənay mukwa la lig aŋha la ahəŋ, Yesu azə̀ɓ Piyer, Yakuba ŋgaha Yuhana, deda aŋa Yakuba, ŋgaha adàla atà à gəl gudəŋ kərkər gà à afik, kokuɗa gəl aŋatà. (Mata 17:1)[2]And after six days Jesus took along Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves. (Matthew 17:1)

river
Iyaw adzəkà masuway, ahənà à mukwà à afik, afaɗ aɗə̀ɗ la ndzəɗa, ŋgaha gày atə̀ɗ à ahəŋ gərim, matəɗ à ahəŋ aŋha kà panàhhà." (Mata 7:27)[1]And the rain came down and the river came and the wind blew and beat against that house, and it collapsed, and its fall was great.” (Matthew 7:27)

forest
Kasəlaw kà, kà bəzi akàl kà, abaɓəh mələm məŋga à gay gesina, ɓəhbaɓəh. (Yakuba 3:5)[1]Behold how small a fire sets ablaze how great a forest! (James 3:5)
to die, Kiya uwaga Yakuba ahàd à kutso Misəra à slaka

big, great
La məŋ gày la aku kà, azlatasà luwàluwà la azlaaŋa gursu pəra la aku aw.[1]Now in a great house there are not only gold and silver vessels (2 Timothy 2:20)
Məŋ sufəl aŋa azla RomRoman Emperor, Caesar (lit. great king of the Romans)

seven
Ŋgaha la lig aŋa madz à ahəŋ titi la ahəŋ, gənəŋà azlamalika məɗəf uwana tatsàzl à ahəŋ la huma Zəzagəla, taɓəzàl mazlazliŋ məɗəf la slaka aŋha. (Mafətala 8:2)[1]And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them. (Revelation 8:2)
to see, Mənəŋaŋ kà taɓə̀k asik à slaka maduw ləv à
to wash, cleanse, Akul, azla Farisəya kà kapalahaw
cat

to drink, Kà uwana may azà à gi, kavàw à gi tatak may,

to come, La kità Yuhana asà à waŋ, azùw aw, asà aw,

life
sifa adəveternal life
Zəzagəla avà à anu sifa adəv à gay aw, sifa uwaga kà avà à anu, kà la Kona aŋha la abà. (Yuhana 5:11)[1]God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son (John 5:11)

egg
Awma baŋa anaval slaslay ma avàl aliz ay? (Luka 11:12)[1]Or also, if he will ask for an egg, will give him a scorpion? (Luke 11:12)
saliva

snow
Aŋidz aŋha kà, meɗekuga sayya, bokuba slewzi (Mafətala 1:14)[1]His foot [is] white like wool, like snow (Revelation 1:14)

root

tooth
'Yewdi mapəlay la yewdi, sliɗ bay mapəlay la sliɗ (Mata 3:38)[1]An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth. (Matthew 5:38)

salt
"Akul la uwana akul azlaslugul aŋa gudəŋ à vok. Ama baŋa slugul azlaɗay aya aw ma, la mana tazlaɗəŋ ala aya ma? Akəsà vok aya aw, say mafətəkw ala pəra, ŋgaha azladza tamələŋ à tsəh."(Mata 5:13)[1]You are the salt of the earth. But if salt becomes tasteless, by what will it be made salty?
